text: Hey guys, welcome to Production Music Live. My name is Fran√ßois. Today for Ableton Tips
and we are making a cool sound out of the Analog In-It patch. So let's go to Instruments
Analog, pick up a new instance and load it onto a new MIDI channel. And this is what
it sounds like by default. Bring down the filter to something more pleasing. Turn off
oscillator 2. So we're only working with the first oscillator of this instrument and the
shape is set to saw wave. And also we want to go into the filter settings and bring the attack
time up. So it's a bit more smooth in the beginning. Now bring up the sustain. And let's play a nice
chord progression with the sound. I have this one here prepared, copying it over. This is what it
looks like. It's part of our Chords for Life free MIDI pack download. You can find a link in the
description. This is what it sounds like. Let's quickly bring this down an octave.
We can add in some glide here in analog so it glides into the chord a bit more so it slides in
there. Nice. And we can also add in some vibrato. I'm exaggerating this one. So keep this one around
40 here. And now we can add in some reverb. Go to audio effects and search for reverb quickly.
And pick up this one. Decay time up to maybe two seconds here and drive it down a bit.
And we can actually add in a kick sound now to make this groove a bit more. And whenever you add
in a kick sound, you kind of want to sidechain your pad quickly. So I'm quickly copying over a
sidechain device here and sidechaining this one to the kick. So playing around with the filter,
you notice what a nice sound. Okay, let's quickly make a copy of this one and use it as a bass
sound. So duplicating this one. And we're just going to delete all these upper notes here,
keeping the lower ones as our bass notes and turning off the reverb on this copy and bringing
the whole thing down an octave. So it sounds like this now. I'm also bringing down a filter.
Now we need a melody. So let's take another duplicate of the pad sound here. And I'm putting
this one below the bass. And I'm also quickly going to copy over a melody. So this little
pattern here, let's listen in. A shorter attack time is needed on this analog sound. Now let's
bring it back to like six milliseconds and decay time down as well. And bring the sustain down
all the way. So now we have a plucky sound. And turn off vibrato and turn off glide here. Instead,
we are going to turn on the noise oscillator and bring the color up to like five kilohertz. So really
properly hear it. And now we can bring the mix down because we are mixing in oscillator one at
zero decibels. So let's bring this down like by six. Nice. And now we have a nice sound for
a melody we can play around with filter. Super nice analog-ish sounding melody. And now we can
take a delay from our delays and loops. Let's pick up the delay here and detach left from right and
and maybe set it to four by six. To ping pong. A bit more to the high frequencies here. Exact
values don't matter at much but bring down the feedback and the dry wet. Playing around with
frequency here. And now let's also take a longer reverb. Hybrid reverb. Large shimmer plate right
behind it. Too large. So let's bring the dry wet down to like 20%. Okay, go to the EQ quickly and
bring this one down to flat zero. And bring the blend to the tail. So something like keep a little
bit of the early reflections but bring the blend to almost all the way up. So we have a nice melodic
house type room here for the sound. Okay, let's play everything together. And we have to bring
down the filter of the pad sound a little so we have more room for our melody. And obviously we
can automate the filter now over time if we select this knob here and bring it down and bring it
higher up and then back down something like this. And maybe add in some drums here. Perk loop.
And there we have already a song idea evolving here just from the analog in it patch which just
sounds really nice. So I hope you enjoyed this little session. Feel free to like and subscribe,
comment below what you want to see next. If you're interested in the drum samples there
